Experience an all-new old adventure! Fight your way through hordes of strange, silly, and scary monsters! Explore the caves, castles, and dungeons of an ancient evil! Meet warriors, princes, pirates, zombies, and crazy old woodsmen in a huge world of epic retro adventure!

About This Game

Experience an all-new old adventure! Fight your way through hordes of strange, silly, and scary monsters! Explore the caves, castles, and dungeons of an ancient evil! Meet warriors, princes, pirates, zombies, and crazy old woodsmen in a huge world of epic retro adventure! Authentic 8-bit artwork and an original soundtrack by renowned Bay Area 8-bit musician Crashfaster keeps the game true to its retro roots.
READ MORE

Enderminer360
8 products in account
1 review
Recommended
6.3 hrs on record
Posted: June 15
It is a great game that incorporates the basics that were pioneered in Ultima and that was improvised in early JRPG's and made something spectacular. It has wit that makes it great to read the text in town very similar to another JRPG game series and ties it in with basic elements so that you wont be scrambling around and trying to find a strategy guide you just pick up and play. If you are looking for a quick and simple game to pick up and play what are you waiting for why isn't this game in your cart yet or at least on your wish list. However, if you are looking for a game that is deep and you will need a billion paged strategy guide for do not buy because this game will not fill your satisfaction. I really hope that this game gets some attention because all of us knows it desrves it. Just like the good old NES.

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
Schnappi07 | dsr07gaming.com
235 products in account
12 reviews
Recommended
9.9 hrs on record
Posted: August 9
Keep on mind i've never been even remotely close to beating 8/16bit RPG. When I was younger and I had NES/SNES I didnt know English so I didnt see point in playing those games.

This is first and so far most pleasure experiance in this genre. Unfortunately I can't compare this to any similiar game but if you never played this kind of games it's suprisingly positive experiance. Storyline from 3 point of views including last a bit short Minecraft chapter made me smile. It took me about 10 hours with roaming around, farming exp and exploring including going back 2 times in completed chapter on couple minutes to grab missing achievements.

Story was kinda cute (I really cant find other way to describe it), totally apropriate to Fantasy world although secretely I hoped for more dragons :)

Variaty of spells and even items, party up to 4 characters with a little bit of space for strategy into fights was enough to buy me.

As I mentioned completely new to this genre only because I was prevented as younger due to not knowing english and later being occupied by new PC games, I feel sorry that I missed completely this genre and type of games. First but definitely not last title and this one will always stay in my memories.

Ryu
228 products in account
43 reviews
Recommended
8.5 hrs on record
Posted: April 22
Well..I just finished all of the chapters in this game and I have to say hands down it is awesome..the battle system plays out like Dragon Quest, this game has some very creative dialog, & the quests will make you keep playing in order to figure out what is going on. If there is ever a Book II for this game, I am so picking it up.

But if you should pick up this game I say defitenly, it's one RPG that's hard to put down.

Chaedog
616 products in account
21 reviews
Recommended
10.1 hrs on record
Posted: April 13
Great game, if you grew up playing RPG's like Final Fantasy and Dragon's Quest on your NES then this will bring back some wonderful memories. Fun light hearted RPG that's pretty straight forward and all around fun game to kill some time with. Enjoyable poking around and seeing what funny dialog you can find from random bookshelves or NPCs.

adolson

Recommended
3.9 hrs on record
Posted: April 16
Dragon Quest mashed with Final Fantasy. Level-grinding and random turn-based battles in 8- or 16-bit style - it feels like I'm a kid again. A masterful homage to the games of yesteryear.
